form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to permanently extend increased expensing limitations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the America’s Small Business Tax Relief Act of 2015.

section.header: Expensing certain depreciable business assets for small business

paragraph.text: Section 179(b)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking shall not exceed— and all that follows and inserting shall not exceed $500,000..
Section 179(b)(2) of such Code is amended by striking exceeds— and all that follows and inserting exceeds $2,000,000..

subsection.text: Section 179(d)(1)(A)(ii) of such Code is amended by striking , to which section 167 applies, and which is placed in service in a taxable year beginning after 2002 and before 2015 and inserting and to which section 167 applies.
Section 179(c)(2) of such Code is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking may not be revoked and all that follows through and before 2015; and
by striking irrevocable in the heading thereof.

subsection.text: Section 179(d)(1) of such Code is amended by striking and shall not include air conditioning or heating units.
Section 179(f) of such Code is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking beginning after 2009 and before 2015 in paragraph (1); and

subsection.text: Section 179(b) of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: In the case of any taxable year beginning after 2015, the dollar amounts in paragraphs (1) and (2) shall each be increased by an amount equal to—

clause.text: the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting calendar year 2014 for calendar year 1992 in subparagraph (B) thereof.

subparagraph.text: The amount of any increase under subparagraph (A) shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10,000.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Reduced recognition period for built-in gains of S corporations made permanent

subsection.text: Paragraph (7) of section 1374(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: The term recognition period means the 5-year period beginning with the first day of the first taxable year for which the corporation was an S corporation. For purposes of applying this section to any amount includible in income by reason of distributions to shareholders pursuant to section 593(e), the preceding sentence shall be applied without regard to the phrase 5-year.

If an S corporation sells an asset and reports the income from the sale using the installment method under section 453, the treatment of all payments received shall be governed by the provisions of this paragraph applicable to the taxable year in which such sale was made.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Permanent rule regarding basis adjustment to stock of S corporations making charitable contributions of property

subsection.text: Section 1367(a)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking the last sentence.
The amendment made by this section shall apply to contributions made in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.

section.text: The budgetary effects of this Act shall not be entered on either PAYGO scorecard maintained pursuant to section 4(d) of the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives February 13, 2015.
